alert.note: Alert for Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 2:16AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison, southeastern Hancock and Jackson Counties through 330 AM CST... At 216 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Saucier to near Waveland. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Diamondhead, Gautier, D`iberville, Wade, Saucier, Helena, Hurley, Gulf Park Estates, Latimer, Big Point and Lyman. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 10 and 76. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
